sen.j: 羽田矢国（はたのやくに、生年不明 - 朱鳥元年（686年）3月25日没）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HATA no Yakuni (the date of birth unknown - died on March 25, 686) was a historical figure lived in the Asuka Period in Japan.
HATA no Yakuni (the date of birth unknown - died on April 26, 686) was a historical figure lived during Japan's Asuka Period.
HATA no Yakuni (the date of birth unknown - died on April 26, 686) was a historical figure lived during Japan's Asuka Period.

sen.j: 名は八国とも書く。
sen.e: His name "矢国" was also written as "八国."
His name "矢国" was also written as "八国."
His name "矢国" was also written as "八国."

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: How to pronounce his name is the same even though the name is written in the old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced the same in the old Japanese kana syllabary.
His name is pronounced the same in the old Japanese kana syllabary.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は公、後に真人。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi later changed to Mahito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi and later promoted to Mahito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi and later promoted to Mahito.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側に寝返り、琵琶湖北回りの軍を率いて三尾城を攻略した。
sen.e: He had betrayed Omi Imperial Court and came to side Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) and Emperor Tenmu; he lead an advancing troop on a northern route along Lake Biwa and took over Sanbi Castle in the Jinshin War in 672.
sen.cmt: 「寝返った」は"betrayed"ですが、目的語なないと意味がよくわからないので、下の文を読んで補足しました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War of 672, he changed sides to support Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later Emperor Tenmu) and led the troop on a northern route along Lake Biwa to take over the Mionoki Castle.
sen.cmt: 「大海人皇子（天武天皇）」はひとりの人物です。また、原文にない語を追加しないために訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War of 672, he changed sides to support Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later Emperor Tenmu) and led the troop on a northern route along Lake Biwa to take over the Mionoki Castle.

sen.j: 大弁官。
sen.e: He was Daibenkan (Major Controller).
He was Daibenkan (Major Controller).
He was Daibenkan (Major Controller).

sen.j: 贈直大壱。
sen.e: He was awarded with Jikidaiichi.
He was awarded with Jikidaiichi.
He was awarded with Jikidaiichi.

tit.e: Yakuni's Great Success in the Jinshin War
tit.cmt: great successはそぐわないので修正しました。

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、羽田矢国は近江の朝廷の軍の将として、山部王、蘇我果安、巨勢比等（巨勢人）が率いた数万の軍の中にあった。
sen.e: At the break of the Jinshin War, HATA no Yakuni was a shogun of Omi Imperial Court army and surrounded by several tens of thousands of soldiers lead by YAMABE no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), SOGA no Hatayasu, and KOSE no Hito.

When the Jinshin War broke out, HATA no Yakuni was a shogun of the Omi Imperial Court army among several tens of thousands of soldiers led by YAMABE no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), SOGA no Hatayasu, and KOSE no Hito.
sen.cmt: 冒頭とsurrounded byを書き換えました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, HATA no Yakuni was a shogun of the Omi Imperial Court army among several tens of thousands of soldiers led by YAMABE no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), SOGA no Hatayasu, and KOSE no Hito.

sen.j: この軍は琵琶湖東岸を進んで美濃国の不破郡にある大海人皇子の本拠を攻撃しようとした。
sen.e: HATA's army planned to attack the headquarters of Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province by following a route along the east coast of Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This army planned to attack the headquarters of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province by following a route along the east coast of Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) はOama no Miko (Prince Oama)の間違いです。
sen.e: This army planned to attack the headquarters of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province by following a route along the east coast of Lake Biwa.

sen.j: しかし、7月2日頃に果安と比等が山部王を殺したため、混乱して止まった。
sen.e: However, Hatayasu and Hito killed YAMABE no Okimi so the army halted the advance in confusion around July 2.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Hatayasu and Hito killed YAMABE no Okimi sometime around August 2 and the army halted the advance in confusion.
However, Hatayasu and Hito killed YAMABE no Okimi sometime around August 2 and the army halted the advance in confusion.

sen.j: このとき、近江の将軍羽田公矢国とその子羽田大人らは己の族を率いて大海人皇子側に寝返った。
sen.e: This was when Omi's shogun, HATA no Kimi Yakuni, and his child, HATA no Ushi, betrayed Omi Imperial Court; they urged their families and joined forces with Oama no Miko's.
This was when a shogun of Omi army HATA no Kimi Yakuni and his son HATA no Ushi, followed by other members of Hata family, changed sides to support Oama no Miko.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: This was when a shogun of Omi army HATA no Kimi Yakuni and his son HATA no Ushi, followed by other members of Hata family, changed sides to support Oama no Miko.

sen.j: 斧鉞を授かり、将軍となり、ただちに北越に行くよう命じられた。
sen.e: Yakuni was bestowed Fuetsu (a ceremonial ax), assigned to a shogun, and ordered to go to Koshi Province at once.
Yakuni was bestowed Fuetsu (a ceremonial ax), assigned to a shogun, and ordered to go to Hokuetsu at once.
sen.cmt: Koshi Provinceでも意味は同じですが、原文の文字通りHokuetsuにしました。
sen.e: Yakuni was bestowed Fuetsu (a ceremonial ax), assigned to a shogun, and ordered to go to Hokuetsu at once.

sen.j: 矢国は琵琶湖東岸を北進して越国への入り口を押さえてから、西岸を南下したらしい。
sen.e: Most likely, Yakuni headed north along the east coast of Lake Biwa, blocked the entrance to Koshi Province, then headed south along the west coast of Lake Biwa.
It is believed that Yakuni headed north along the east coast of Lake Biwa, blocked the entrance to Koshi Province, then headed south along the west coast of the lake.
sen.cmt: 文頭と文末を書き換えました。
sen.e: It is believed that Yakuni headed north along the east coast of Lake Biwa, blocked the entrance to Koshi Province, then headed south along the west coast of the lake.

sen.j: 7月22日、矢国は出雲狛とともに三尾城を攻め、これを降した。
sen.e: Yakuni together with IZUMO no Koma attacked and took over Sanbi Castle on July 22.
On August 23, Yakuni attacked the Mionoki Castle together with IZUMO no Koma and took it over.
On August 23, Yakuni attacked the Mionoki Castle together with IZUMO no Koma and took it over.

sen.j: この三尾は、現在の滋賀県高島市にある三尾里にあたると推定されている。
sen.e: The location of Sanbi is believed to be near the present-day Mio Sanbizato in Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
The location of Sanbi is believed to be present-day Miozato in Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
The location of Sanbi is believed to be present-day Miozato in Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 同じ日に味方の主力軍は瀬田で敵の最後の防衛線を破った。
sen.e: The main troop of Oama no Miko defeated the last line of defense of Omi's army in Seta on the same day.
The main troop of Oama no Miko defeated the last line of defense of Omi's army in Seta on the same day.
The main troop of Oama no Miko defeated the last line of defense of Omi's army in Seta on the same day.

sen.j: 翌23日に大友皇子（弘文天皇）が自殺し、乱は終わった。
sen.e: Otomo no Oji comitted suicide on the follwing day on 23, and the Jinshin War came to the end.
On the following day, Otomo no Oji committed suicide and the Jinshin War came to the end.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を修正しました。
sen.e: On the following day, Otomo no Oji committed suicide and the Jinshin War came to the end.

sen.j: 戦後、天武天皇元年（672年）12月4日に、壬申の乱での勲功者の冠位が進められ、小山の位以上が与えられた。
sen.e: After the war, retainers who made great contributions to the victory were promoted to the ranks higher than Oyama on December 4, 672.
After the war, on December 31, 672, retainers who made great contributions to the victory were promoted to the ranks of Shosen or higher.
sen.cmt: 新暦に変換し、「小山」をShosenに修正しました。
sen.e: After the war, on December 31, 672, retainers who made great contributions to the victory were promoted to the ranks of Shosen or higher.

sen.j: 羽田矢国もそれ以上の位を授けられたと考えられる。
sen.e: It is said that HATA no Yakuni was also awarded the rank higher than Oyama.
It is believed that HATA no Yakuni was also promoted to an equivalent rank.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: It is believed that HATA no Yakuni was also promoted to an equivalent rank.

sen.j: 天武天皇12年（683年）12月13日に、伊勢王、羽田八国、多品治、中臣大島は、判官・録史・工匠といった部下を引き連れて全国を巡り、諸国の境界を定めた。
sen.e: ISE no O, HATA no Yakuni, O no Hhonji, and NAKATOMI no Oshima traveled all over the country accompanied by their subordinates, hangan (Judge Magistrate), rokushi (secretaries keeping records), and kosho (engineers) on December 13, 683; they sat boundaries among various districts.
sen.cmt: 録史はほかに読み方があるかもしれませんが、"ろくし"としました。
sen.e: On January 8, 684, ISE no O, HATA no Yakuni, O no Honji, and NAKATOMI no Oshima set off on a journey around the country to set boundaries between provinces accompanied by their subordinates including hangan (Judge Magistrate), rokushi (secretaries keeping records), and kosho (engineers).
sen.cmt: 新暦に変換しました。1日で全国を巡るのは不自然なので「全国を巡る旅に出た」と解釈しました。
sen.e: On January 8, 684, ISE no O, HATA no Yakuni, O no Honji, and NAKATOMI no Oshima set off on a journey around the country to set boundaries between provinces accompanied by their subordinates including hangan (Judge Magistrate), rokushi (secretaries keeping records), and kosho (engineers).

sen.j: この事業は年内には終わらなかった。
sen.e: This project wasn't completed by the end of the year.
This project wasn't completed by the end of the month.
sen.cmt: 新暦では翌年1月になってしまうので、「その月のうちに」と訳しました。
sen.e: This project wasn't completed by the end of the month.

sen.j: 八国の位はこのとき大錦下であった。
sen.e: The rank of Yakuni at this time was Daikinge.
The rank of Yakuni at this time was Daikinge.

sen.e: HATA clan was given kabane, Mahito, in 684.
In 684, HATA clan was given a kabane of Mahito.
In 684, HATA clan was given a kabane of Mahito.

sen.e: Daibenkan (Major Controller) Jikidaisan HATA no Mahito Yakuni became ill on March 6, 686; three men were asked to enter the Buddhist priesthood to pray for his illness.
Daibenkan (Major Controller) Jikidaisan HATA no Mahito Yakuni became ill on April 7, 686, and three men were asked to enter the Buddhist priesthood to pray for his illness.

sen.e: Yakuni died on 25.
Yakuni died on April 26.
